name: Kepler-237
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-237 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-237 is a star with 0.615 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.72 times its radius. It is located 2186.58 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-237 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-237 b

Kepler-237 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-237.

The mass of Kepler-237 b is 2.20 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-237 b is 1.41 that of Earth. At 2.20 Earth masses, Kepler-237 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-237 c

Kepler-237 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.10 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-237.

The mass of Kepler-237 c is 5.61 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-237 c is 2.08 that of Earth. At 5.61 Earth masses, Kepler-237 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-237, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
